intro: Darniella schweinfurthii, commonly known as the Schweinfurth's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers and basal rosette of leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a strong, bitter taste. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
